poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The sower sowed his neatly stored Instructions for the fall. A scold stowed some in sutras. The sower strode and sang, then, ROTAS OPERA TENET AREPO SATOR The sad scold understood Ten potatoes pose a rare tort. He scowled. And soldiered on. The black Birds of the airways soared and strolled In clover. Who sold the sower? It snowed grain. Time Slowed to the speed of Stoned crows. Under his feet The sutured runrig scrolled.
